extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.elasticsearch.PutElasticsearchHttpRecord
extension.description: Writes the records from a FlowFile into to Elasticsearch, using the specified parameters such as the index to insert into and the type of the document, as well as the operation type (index, upsert, delete, etc.). Note: The Bulk API is used to send the records. This means that the entire contents of the incoming flow file are read into memory, and each record is transformed into a JSON document which is added to a single HTTP request body. For very large flow files (files with a large number of records, e.g.), this could cause memory usage issues.

property.name: elasticsearch-http-url
property.description: Elasticsearch URL which will be connected to, including scheme (http, e.g.), host, and port. The default port for the REST API is 9200.

property.name: SSL Context Service
property.description: The SSL Context Service used to provide client certificate information for TLS/SSL connections. This service only applies if the Elasticsearch endpoint(s) have been secured with TLS/SSL.

property.name: Character Set
property.description: Specifies the character set of the document data.

property.name: Username
property.description: Username to access the Elasticsearch cluster

property.name: Password
property.description: Password to access the Elasticsearch cluster

property.name: elasticsearch-http-connect-timeout
property.description: Max wait time for the connection to the Elasticsearch REST API.

property.name: elasticsearch-http-response-timeout
property.description: Max wait time for a response from the Elasticsearch REST API.

property.name: proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Specifies the Proxy Configuration Controller Service to proxy network requests. If set, it supersedes proxy settings configured per component. Supported proxies: HTTP + AuthN, SOCKS

property.name: elasticsearch-http-proxy-host
property.description: The fully qualified hostname or IP address of the proxy server

property.name: elasticsearch-http-proxy-port
property.description: The port of the proxy server

property.name: proxy-username
property.description: Proxy Username

property.name: proxy-password
property.description: Proxy Password

property.name: put-es-record-record-reader
property.description: Specifies the Controller Service to use for parsing incoming data and determining the data's schema.

property.name: put-es-record-record-writer
property.description: After sending a batch of records, Elasticsearch will report if individual records failed to insert. As an example, this can happen if the record doesn't match the mappingfor the index it is being inserted into. This property specifies the Controller Service to use for writing out those individual records sent to 'failure'. If this is not set, then the whole FlowFile will be routed to failure (including any records which may have been inserted successfully). Note that this will only be used if Elasticsearch reports that individual records failed and that in the event that the entire FlowFile fails (e.g. in the event ES is down), the FF will be routed to failure without being interpreted by this record writer. If there is an error while attempting to route the failures, the entire FlowFile will be routed to Failure. Also if every record failed individually, the entire FlowFile will be routed to Failure without being parsed by the writer.

property.name: put-es-record-log-all-errors
property.description: After sending a batch of records, Elasticsearch will report if individual records failed to insert. As an example, this can happen if the record doesn't match the mapping for the index it is being inserted into. If this is set to true, the processor will log the failure reason for the every failed record. When set to false only the first error in the batch will be logged.

property.name: put-es-record-id-path
property.description: A RecordPath pointing to a field in the record(s) that contains the identifier for the document. If the Index Operation is "index", this property may be left empty or evaluate to an empty value, in which case the document's identifier will be auto-generated by Elasticsearch. For all other Index Operations, the field's value must be non-empty.

property.name: put-es-record-index
property.description: The name of the index to insert into

property.name: put-es-record-type
property.description: The type of this document (used by Elasticsearch for indexing and searching)

property.name: put-es-record-index-op
property.description: The type of the operation used to index (index, update, upsert, delete)

property.name: suppress-nulls
property.description: Specifies how the writer should handle a null field

allowableValue.description: Fields that are missing (present in the schema but not in the record), or that have a value of null, will be written out as a null value
Fields that are missing (present in the schema but not in the record), or that have a value of null, will not be written out
When a field has a value of null, it will be written out. However, if a field is defined in the schema and not present in the record, the field will not be written out.

property.name: Date Format
property.description: Specifies the format to use when reading/writing Date fields. If not specified, the default format 'yyyy-MM-dd' is used. If specified, the value must match the Java Simple Date Format (for example, MM/dd/yyyy for a two-digit month, followed by a two-digit day, followed by a four-digit year, all separated by '/' characters, as in 01/01/2017).

property.name: Time Format
property.description: Specifies the format to use when reading/writing Time fields. If not specified, the default format 'HH:mm:ss' is used. If specified, the value must match the Java Simple Date Format (for example, HH:mm:ss for a two-digit hour in 24-hour format, followed by a two-digit minute, followed by a two-digit second, all separated by ':' characters, as in 18:04:15).

property.name: Timestamp Format
property.description: Specifies the format to use when reading/writing Timestamp fields. If not specified, the default format 'yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss' is used. If specified, the value must match the Java Simple Date Format (for example, MM/dd/yyyy HH:mm:ss for a two-digit month, followed by a two-digit day, followed by a four-digit year, all separated by '/' characters; and then followed by a two-digit hour in 24-hour format, followed by a two-digit minute, followed by a two-digit second, all separated by ':' characters, as in 01/01/2017 18:04:15).

dynamicProperty.name: A URL query parameter
dynamicProperty.value: The value to set it to
dynamicProperty.description: Adds the specified property name/value as a query parameter in the Elasticsearch URL used for processing

relationship.name: retry
relationship.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship if the database cannot be updated but attempting the operation again may succeed

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: All FlowFiles that are written to Elasticsearch are routed to this relationship

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: All FlowFiles that cannot be written to Elasticsearch are routed to this relationship

writesAttribute.name: record.count
writesAttribute.description: The number of records in an outgoing FlowFile. This is only populated on the 'success' relationship.

writesAttribute.name: failure.count
writesAttribute.description: The number of records found by Elasticsearch to have errors. This is only populated on the 'failure' relationship.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.elasticsearch.FetchElasticsearch
extension.description: Retrieves a document from Elasticsearch using the specified connection properties and the identifier of the document to retrieve. If the cluster has been configured for authorization and/or secure transport (SSL/TLS) and the Shield plugin is available, secure connections can be made. This processor supports Elasticsearch 2.x clusters.

property.name: Cluster Name
property.description: Name of the ES cluster (for example, elasticsearch_brew). Defaults to 'elasticsearch'

property.name: ElasticSearch Hosts
property.description: ElasticSearch Hosts, which should be comma separated and colon for hostname/port host1:port,host2:port,.... For example testcluster:9300. This processor uses the Transport Client to connect to hosts. The default transport client port is 9300.

property.name: SSL Context Service
property.description: The SSL Context Service used to provide client certificate information for TLS/SSL connections. This service only applies if the Elasticsearch endpoint(s) have been secured with TLS/SSL.

property.name: Shield Plugin Filename
property.description: Specifies the path to the JAR for the Elasticsearch Shield plugin. If the Elasticsearch cluster has been secured with the Shield plugin, then the Shield plugin JAR must also be available to this processor. Note: Do NOT place the Shield JAR into NiFi's lib/ directory, doing so will prevent the Shield plugin from being loaded.

property.name: Username
property.description: Username to access the Elasticsearch cluster

property.name: Password
property.description: Password to access the Elasticsearch cluster

property.name: ElasticSearch Ping Timeout
property.description: The ping timeout used to determine when a node is unreachable. For example, 5s (5 seconds). If non-local recommended is 30s

property.name: Sampler Interval
property.description: How often to sample / ping the nodes listed and connected. For example, 5s (5 seconds). If non-local recommended is 30s.

property.name: Document Identifier
property.description: The identifier for the document to be fetched

property.name: Index
property.description: The name of the index to read from

property.name: Type
property.description: The type of this document (used by Elasticsearch for indexing and searching)

property.name: Character Set
property.description: Specifies the character set of the document data.

relationship.name: retry
relationship.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship if the document cannot be fetched but attempting the operation again may succeed

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: All FlowFiles that are read from Elasticsearch are routed to this relationship

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: All FlowFiles that cannot be read from Elasticsearch are routed to this relationship

relationship.name: not found
relationship.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship if the specified document does not exist in the Elasticsearch cluster

writesAttribute.name: filename
writesAttribute.description: The filename attributes is set to the document identifier

writesAttribute.name: es.index
writesAttribute.description: The Elasticsearch index containing the document

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.elasticsearch.ScrollElasticsearchHttp
extension.description: Scrolls through an Elasticsearch query using the specified connection properties. This processor is intended to be run on the primary node, and is designed for scrolling through huge result sets, as in the case of a reindex. The state must be cleared before another query can be run. Each page of results is returned, wrapped in a JSON object like so: { "hits" : [ <doc1>, <doc2>, <docn> ] }. Note that the full body of each page of documents will be read into memory before being written to a Flow File for transfer.

property.name: elasticsearch-http-url
property.description: Elasticsearch URL which will be connected to, including scheme (http, e.g.), host, and port. The default port for the REST API is 9200.

property.name: SSL Context Service
property.description: The SSL Context Service used to provide client certificate information for TLS/SSL connections. This service only applies if the Elasticsearch endpoint(s) have been secured with TLS/SSL.

property.name: Character Set
property.description: Specifies the character set of the document data.

property.name: Username
property.description: Username to access the Elasticsearch cluster

property.name: Password
property.description: Password to access the Elasticsearch cluster

property.name: elasticsearch-http-connect-timeout
property.description: Max wait time for the connection to the Elasticsearch REST API.

property.name: elasticsearch-http-response-timeout
property.description: Max wait time for a response from the Elasticsearch REST API.

property.name: proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Specifies the Proxy Configuration Controller Service to proxy network requests. If set, it supersedes proxy settings configured per component. Supported proxies: HTTP + AuthN, SOCKS

property.name: elasticsearch-http-proxy-host
property.description: The fully qualified hostname or IP address of the proxy server

property.name: elasticsearch-http-proxy-port
property.description: The port of the proxy server

property.name: proxy-username
property.description: Proxy Username

property.name: proxy-password
property.description: Proxy Password

property.name: scroll-es-query
property.description: The Lucene-style query to run against ElasticSearch (e.g., genre:blues AND -artist:muddy)

property.name: scroll-es-scroll
property.description: The scroll duration is how long each search context is kept in memory.

property.name: scroll-es-size
property.description: Determines how many documents to return per page during scrolling.

property.name: scroll-es-index
property.description: The name of the index to read from. If the property is set to _all, the query will match across all indexes.

property.name: scroll-es-type
property.description: The (optional) type of this query, used by Elasticsearch for indexing and searching. If the property is empty, the the query will match across all types.

property.name: scroll-es-fields
property.description: A comma-separated list of fields to retrieve from the document. If the Fields property is left blank, then the entire document's source will be retrieved.

property.name: scroll-es-sort
property.description: A sort parameter (e.g., timestamp:asc). If the Sort property is left blank, then the results will be retrieved in document order.

dynamicProperty.name: A URL query parameter
dynamicProperty.value: The value to set it to
dynamicProperty.description: Adds the specified property name/value as a query parameter in the Elasticsearch URL used for processing

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: All FlowFiles that are read from Elasticsearch are routed to this relationship.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: All FlowFiles that cannot be read from Elasticsearch are routed to this relationship. Note that only incoming flow files will be routed to failure.

writesAttribute.name: es.index
writesAttribute.description: The Elasticsearch index containing the document

stateful.description: After each successful scroll page, the latest scroll_id is persisted in scrollId as input for the next scroll call. Once the entire query is complete, finishedQuery state will be set to true, and the processor will not execute unless this is cleared.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.elasticsearch.PutElasticsearchHttp
extension.description: Writes the contents of a FlowFile to Elasticsearch, using the specified parameters such as the index to insert into and the type of the document.

property.name: elasticsearch-http-url
property.description: Elasticsearch URL which will be connected to, including scheme (http, e.g.), host, and port. The default port for the REST API is 9200.

property.name: SSL Context Service
property.description: The SSL Context Service used to provide client certificate information for TLS/SSL connections. This service only applies if the Elasticsearch endpoint(s) have been secured with TLS/SSL.

property.name: Character Set
property.description: Specifies the character set of the document data.

property.name: Username
property.description: Username to access the Elasticsearch cluster

property.name: Password
property.description: Password to access the Elasticsearch cluster

property.name: elasticsearch-http-connect-timeout
property.description: Max wait time for the connection to the Elasticsearch REST API.

property.name: elasticsearch-http-response-timeout
property.description: Max wait time for a response from the Elasticsearch REST API.

property.name: proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Specifies the Proxy Configuration Controller Service to proxy network requests. If set, it supersedes proxy settings configured per component. Supported proxies: HTTP + AuthN, SOCKS

property.name: elasticsearch-http-proxy-host
property.description: The fully qualified hostname or IP address of the proxy server

property.name: elasticsearch-http-proxy-port
property.description: The port of the proxy server

property.name: proxy-username
property.description: Proxy Username

property.name: proxy-password
property.description: Proxy Password

property.name: put-es-id-attr
property.description: The name of the FlowFile attribute containing the identifier for the document. If the Index Operation is "index", this property may be left empty or evaluate to an empty value, in which case the document's identifier will be auto-generated by Elasticsearch. For all other Index Operations, the attribute must evaluate to a non-empty value.

property.name: put-es-index
property.description: The name of the index to insert into

property.name: put-es-type
property.description: The type of this document (used by Elasticsearch for indexing and searching)

property.name: put-es-batch-size
property.description: The preferred number of flow files to put to the database in a single transaction. Note that the contents of the flow files will be stored in memory until the bulk operation is performed. Also the results should be returned in the same order the flow files were received.

property.name: put-es-index-op
property.description: The type of the operation used to index (index, update, upsert, delete)

dynamicProperty.name: A URL query parameter
dynamicProperty.value: The value to set it to
dynamicProperty.description: Adds the specified property name/value as a query parameter in the Elasticsearch URL used for processing

relationship.name: retry
relationship.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship if the database cannot be updated but attempting the operation again may succeed

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: All FlowFiles that are written to Elasticsearch are routed to this relationship

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: All FlowFiles that cannot be written to Elasticsearch are routed to this relationship

systemResourceConsideration.description: An instance of this component can cause high usage of this system resource. Multiple instances or high concurrency settings may result a degradation of performance.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.elasticsearch.PutElasticsearch
extension.description: Writes the contents of a FlowFile to Elasticsearch, using the specified parameters such as the index to insert into and the type of the document. If the cluster has been configured for authorization and/or secure transport (SSL/TLS) and the Shield plugin is available, secure connections can be made. This processor supports Elasticsearch 2.x clusters.

property.name: Cluster Name
property.description: Name of the ES cluster (for example, elasticsearch_brew). Defaults to 'elasticsearch'

property.name: ElasticSearch Hosts
property.description: ElasticSearch Hosts, which should be comma separated and colon for hostname/port host1:port,host2:port,.... For example testcluster:9300. This processor uses the Transport Client to connect to hosts. The default transport client port is 9300.

property.name: SSL Context Service
property.description: The SSL Context Service used to provide client certificate information for TLS/SSL connections. This service only applies if the Elasticsearch endpoint(s) have been secured with TLS/SSL.

property.name: Shield Plugin Filename
property.description: Specifies the path to the JAR for the Elasticsearch Shield plugin. If the Elasticsearch cluster has been secured with the Shield plugin, then the Shield plugin JAR must also be available to this processor. Note: Do NOT place the Shield JAR into NiFi's lib/ directory, doing so will prevent the Shield plugin from being loaded.

property.name: Username
property.description: Username to access the Elasticsearch cluster

property.name: Password
property.description: Password to access the Elasticsearch cluster

property.name: ElasticSearch Ping Timeout
property.description: The ping timeout used to determine when a node is unreachable. For example, 5s (5 seconds). If non-local recommended is 30s

property.name: Sampler Interval
property.description: How often to sample / ping the nodes listed and connected. For example, 5s (5 seconds). If non-local recommended is 30s.

property.name: Identifier Attribute
property.description: The name of the attribute containing the identifier for each FlowFile

property.name: Index
property.description: The name of the index to insert into

property.name: Type
property.description: The type of this document (used by Elasticsearch for indexing and searching)

property.name: Character Set
property.description: Specifies the character set of the document data.

property.name: Batch Size
property.description: The preferred number of FlowFiles to put to the database in a single transaction

property.name: Index Operation
property.description: The type of the operation used to index (index, update, upsert)

relationship.name: retry
relationship.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship if the database cannot be updated but attempting the operation again may succeed

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: All FlowFiles that are written to Elasticsearch are routed to this relationship

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: All FlowFiles that cannot be written to Elasticsearch are routed to this relationship

systemResourceConsideration.description: An instance of this component can cause high usage of this system resource. Multiple instances or high concurrency settings may result a degradation of performance.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.elasticsearch.FetchElasticsearchHttp
extension.description: Retrieves a document from Elasticsearch using the specified connection properties and the identifier of the document to retrieve. Note that the full body of the document will be read into memory before being written to a Flow File for transfer.

property.name: elasticsearch-http-url
property.description: Elasticsearch URL which will be connected to, including scheme (http, e.g.), host, and port. The default port for the REST API is 9200.

property.name: SSL Context Service
property.description: The SSL Context Service used to provide client certificate information for TLS/SSL connections. This service only applies if the Elasticsearch endpoint(s) have been secured with TLS/SSL.

property.name: Character Set
property.description: Specifies the character set of the document data.

property.name: Username
property.description: Username to access the Elasticsearch cluster

property.name: Password
property.description: Password to access the Elasticsearch cluster

property.name: elasticsearch-http-connect-timeout
property.description: Max wait time for the connection to the Elasticsearch REST API.

property.name: elasticsearch-http-response-timeout
property.description: Max wait time for a response from the Elasticsearch REST API.

property.name: proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Specifies the Proxy Configuration Controller Service to proxy network requests. If set, it supersedes proxy settings configured per component. Supported proxies: HTTP + AuthN, SOCKS

property.name: elasticsearch-http-proxy-host
property.description: The fully qualified hostname or IP address of the proxy server

property.name: elasticsearch-http-proxy-port
property.description: The port of the proxy server

property.name: proxy-username
property.description: Proxy Username

property.name: proxy-password
property.description: Proxy Password

property.name: fetch-es-doc-id
property.description: The identifier of the document to be fetched

property.name: fetch-es-index
property.description: The name of the index to read from.

property.name: fetch-es-type
property.description: The (optional) type of this document, used by Elasticsearch for indexing and searching. If the property is empty, the first document matching the identifier across all types will be retrieved.

property.name: fetch-es-fields
property.description: A comma-separated list of fields to retrieve from the document. If the Fields property is left blank, then the entire document's source will be retrieved.

dynamicProperty.name: A URL query parameter
dynamicProperty.value: The value to set it to
dynamicProperty.description: Adds the specified property name/value as a query parameter in the Elasticsearch URL used for processing

relationship.name: retry
relationship.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship if the document cannot be fetched but attempting the operation again may succeed. Note that if the processor has no incoming connections, flow files may still be sent to this relationship based on the processor properties and the results of the fetch operation.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: All FlowFiles that are read from Elasticsearch are routed to this relationship.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: All FlowFiles that cannot be read from Elasticsearch are routed to this relationship. Note that only incoming flow files will be routed to failure.

relationship.name: not found
relationship.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship if the specified document does not exist in the Elasticsearch cluster. Note that if the processor has no incoming connections, flow files may still be sent to this relationship based on the processor properties and the results of the fetch operation.

writesAttribute.name: filename
writesAttribute.description: The filename attribute is set to the document identifier

writesAttribute.name: es.index
writesAttribute.description: The Elasticsearch index containing the document

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.elasticsearch.QueryElasticsearchHttp
extension.description: Queries Elasticsearch using the specified connection properties. Note that the full body of each page of documents will be read into memory before being written to Flow Files for transfer. Also note that the Elasticsearch max_result_window index setting is the upper bound on the number of records that can be retrieved using this query. To retrieve more records, use the ScrollElasticsearchHttp processor.

property.name: elasticsearch-http-url
property.description: Elasticsearch URL which will be connected to, including scheme (http, e.g.), host, and port. The default port for the REST API is 9200.

property.name: SSL Context Service
property.description: The SSL Context Service used to provide client certificate information for TLS/SSL connections. This service only applies if the Elasticsearch endpoint(s) have been secured with TLS/SSL.

property.name: Character Set
property.description: Specifies the character set of the document data.

property.name: Username
property.description: Username to access the Elasticsearch cluster

property.name: Password
property.description: Password to access the Elasticsearch cluster

property.name: elasticsearch-http-connect-timeout
property.description: Max wait time for the connection to the Elasticsearch REST API.

property.name: elasticsearch-http-response-timeout
property.description: Max wait time for a response from the Elasticsearch REST API.

property.name: proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Specifies the Proxy Configuration Controller Service to proxy network requests. If set, it supersedes proxy settings configured per component. Supported proxies: HTTP + AuthN, SOCKS

property.name: elasticsearch-http-proxy-host
property.description: The fully qualified hostname or IP address of the proxy server

property.name: elasticsearch-http-proxy-port
property.description: The port of the proxy server

property.name: proxy-username
property.description: Proxy Username

property.name: proxy-password
property.description: Proxy Password

property.name: query-es-query
property.description: The Lucene-style query to run against ElasticSearch (e.g., genre:blues AND -artist:muddy)

property.name: query-es-size
property.description: Determines how many documents to return per page during scrolling.

property.name: query-es-index
property.description: The name of the index to read from. If the property is set to _all, the query will match across all indexes.

property.name: query-es-type
property.description: The (optional) type of this query, used by Elasticsearch for indexing and searching. If the property is empty, the the query will match across all types.

property.name: query-es-fields
property.description: A comma-separated list of fields to retrieve from the document. If the Fields property is left blank, then the entire document's source will be retrieved.

property.name: query-es-sort
property.description: A sort parameter (e.g., timestamp:asc). If the Sort property is left blank, then the results will be retrieved in document order.

property.name: query-es-limit
property.description: If set, limits the number of results that will be returned.

property.name: query-es-target
property.description: Indicates where the results should be placed. In the case of 'Flow file content', the JSON response will be written as the content of the flow file. In the case of 'Flow file attributes', the original flow file (if applicable) will be cloned for each result, and all return fields will be placed in a flow file attribute of the same name, but prefixed by 'es.result.'

property.name: routing-query-info-strategy
property.description: Specifies when to generate and route Query Info after a successful query

allowableValue.description: Route Query Info if the Query returns no hits
Always append Query Info as attributes, using the existing relationships (does not add the Query Info relationship).

dynamicProperty.name: A URL query parameter
dynamicProperty.value: The value to set it to
dynamicProperty.description: Adds the specified property name/value as a query parameter in the Elasticsearch URL used for processing

relationship.name: retry
relationship.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship if the document cannot be fetched but attempting the operation again may succeed. Note that if the processor has no incoming connections, flow files may still be sent to this relationship based on the processor properties and the results of the fetch operation.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: All FlowFiles that are read from Elasticsearch are routed to this relationship.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: All FlowFiles that cannot be read from Elasticsearch are routed to this relationship. Note that only incoming flow files will be routed to failure.

writesAttribute.name: filename
writesAttribute.description: The filename attribute is set to the document identifier

writesAttribute.name: es.query.hitcount
writesAttribute.description: The number of hits for a query

writesAttribute.name: es.index
writesAttribute.description: The Elasticsearch index containing the document

writesAttribute.name: es.query.url
writesAttribute.description: The Elasticsearch query that was built

writesAttribute.name: es.result.*
writesAttribute.description: If Target is 'Flow file attributes', the JSON attributes of each result will be placed into corresponding attributes with this prefix.
